noun.description: A bell or a metal bar or tube, typically one of a set tuned to produce a melodious series of ringing sounds when struck.

verb.description: (of a bell or clock) make melodious ringing sounds, typically to indicate the time.

examples: his poem chimes with our modern experience of loss

phrases: “Yes, you do that,” Doreen chimed in eagerly
Tansy chimes in, her big brown eyes sparkling, You'll never have to leave!
Just thought I'd chime in during the commercial break.
I normally refrain from chiming in to an editor, but this story piqued my civic conscience.
The young woman's male counterpart quickly chimed in, interrupting her.
origin: Late Middle English: probably from an Old English word related to Dutch kim and German Kimme. Compare with chine.
